title: [BUG] Keras Summary Too Long for SQL Column
body:
### System information
- **Have I written custom code (as opposed to using a stock example script provided in MLflow)**: No
- **OS Platform and Distribution (e.g., Linux Ubuntu 16.04)**: Mac OSX 10.14 (Client) & Ubuntu 18.04 (Tracking Server)
- **MLflow installed from (source or binary)**: From PyPi
- **MLflow version (run ``mlflow --version``)**: 1.1.0
- **Python version**: 3.6.8
- **npm version, if running the dev UI**: 5.6.0
- **Exact command to reproduce**: _See code to reproduce steps_

### Describe the problem
When using the `mlflow.keras.autolog()` function with a SQL backend on a tracking server, the server is unable to add the **summary** key generated by the autolog function into the database.  The **summary** key is a very long string while the database column is only VARCHAR(250).

### Code to reproduce issue
1. Setup a tracking server using MySQL backend with the following script:
> mlflow server --backend-store-uri mysql+pymysql://user:pass@localhost/db_name --default-artifact-root s3://bucket_name_here --host 0.0.0.0

2. Then used the keras training script here: https://github.com/mlflow/mlflow/blob/master/mlflow/keras.py

3. Added the tracking server uri to the top of the script:

> mlflow.set_tracking_uri('http://mywebsite.com')

4. Ran the training script and received an error on the server.

### Other info / logs
I attempted PostgreSQL instead of MySQL just to attempt and it had the same issue.

Full traceback here: [traceback.txt](https://github.com/mlflow/mlflow/files/3458279/traceback.txt) or [traceback as a gist](https://gist.github.com/fdabek1/1f3a0d82e090f064926e8fe5a0f21aac)
